SENT.plain: Calcium is an important intracellular 'second messenger' in the activation of contractile proteins in vascular smooth muscle cells
Intracellular calcium accumulation probably has a major pathological effect in the occurrence of ischemic cell damage
Calcium antagonists are a heterogenous group of substances with one property in common, that is they interfere with the transmembrane movement of calcium
Their therapeutic usefulness in cerebral vasospasms, migraine and cerebral ischemia is reviewed
